lines.line: I don't think I want to disturb a cave of giants right now...
Wait...
Do not attack!
What the... You can talk?!
Do...
do not...
flig... fight.
You don't want to fight me?
Want...
no, need...
your help.
I must be dreaming. Giants can't talk!
Please...
Okay giant, I'll help you out, but first you need to tell me your name... if you even have one.
Kovac.
Kovac... alright then. So, Kovac, what do you need help with?
Please...
follow in.
Hang on... is this a trick? Are you going to cook and eat me?!
No...
follow.
Woah... What is this place?
Did you build this?
Kovac...
accep... ancestor build.
Giants built this place?
Yes...
long ago.
How? Giants don't build, do they? I thought they were brutes...
Before...
giants differing.
Now...
not.
Huh? I don't understand what you mean.
Look.
Help fix.
You want me to help you by fixing those tools?
Yes.
Okay, I'll help, but first you need to tell me what this place was used for?
Make...
wheelpo... weapons.
Giants made weapons here?
That's incredible! But why do you want to make weapons? Most giants I've come across already have weapons?
giants...
remember.
Remember what?
Giants...
not just...
killers.
Kovac want...
help giants remember.
I see. To be honest, if I hadn't seen this place myself, I wouldn't have believed you.
Alright, Kovac, I'll help you out. What do we need to do first?
We fix tools...
No way! I'm getting out of here. There's no chance I'd trust a giant!
help.
What's left to fix, Kovac?
Hmm...
Trip hammer...
Grindstone...
Polishing wheel...
Thanks!
Kovac, where did you get this chest from?
chest store stuff.
Alright then...
What do you keep in this box?
stuff.
Very insightful...
What is this, Kovac?
look like big bucket.
I can see that, but what's it used for?
maybe we put things in.
Kovac need think about it more.
Having all this lava here without a barrier is quite dangerous.
Kovac agree.
Should we try building something to keep us safe?
no.
Why not?
Just no swim in the hot juice.
What is this table used for, Kovac?
look like we put thing on it.
Kovac not sure what yet.
Kovac think about it more.
This looks a little dangerous. Quite a perilous place to store something.
good place to cook food.
Hot meat very good.
Not everyday you see a waterfall in a cave.
Kovac drink from waterfall...
Hydration impote... importent.
I agree, it's very important.
I think this has seen better days. What was it?
big hammer.
Right... and what did it do?
Hit things.
Very perceptive, Kovac.
Let me take a look and see if I can fix it.
That looks like it'll do the trick. What do you think?
that look right.
What's it supposed to do?
Kovac think Kovac figure it out.
Go on.
Trip hammer power by water...
Water spin wheel and raise hammer.
Hammer fall and crump sword into shape.
That makes sense. Quite resourceful for giants to make something water powered.
Mhm...
What was this meant to be?
Kovac think it was for grinnin... grinding.
I see. It looks like it's lost its teeth.
Kovac conquer.
Conquer? It's already broken! Hitting it more won't help.
Right... now we're agreed, I'll see what I can do to fix it.
Well that required a bit of elbow grease. It should be good to go now.
Thank you small one...
Didn't want to try and help me?
Kovac did not know how...
Kovac beggin... beginning to understand.
Can you tell me what this is used for then?
Grindstone important...
We grind sword against stone...
make sword sharp.
So we use it when making swords?
Okay, what is this thing? It just looks like a wheel to me.
Kovac think he know.
And?
This polishing wheel...
make thing shiny.
Looks like it's lost its soft edge then.
Not my finest work, but I think it will do.
So when would we use the polishing wheel?
Polishing sword impotan... important.
Create perfect killing edge...
very good for sword.
That makes sense.
That's all the tools repaired. Well... as best as I can do.
Kovac begin to understand more now.
I've noticed your speech has been improving over time as well.
Kovac know what say...
but sometime hard say proppel... properly.
That's alright, we'll figure it out together.
Kovac agree. Ready to make sword?
Yes! I'm itching to get started.
Kovac get few things ready first...
then we can start.
Okay Kovac, I think I'm ready to make a sword.
Kovac feel like things look correct...
Kovac think you are right.
So what do I need to do to make a sword?
First...
you will need a coliti... commission.
Where can I get one of those?
Kovac will supply them...
Kovac already gotten one from old friend.
Okay, so what do I need to make?
Kovac need a Flat Broad sword.
Great!
How do I make that?
Kovac think we need to fill the...
how's it called...
the big stone bucket...
Oh, you mean a crucible?
Yes, thank you...
Kovac think we need to fill the crucible with metal first.
Kovac has been connecti... collecting metals...
They're in that box-crate by entry.
Use bars and weapons...
Crucible can take both.
Load metals into crucible until it looks full.
While you do that...
Kovac think about next thing we need to do.
Alright, I've got the metal you said to take from the box. What now?
You will need to fill the crucible...
Add metals, armour or weapon you find to fill it.
We stick to bronze and iron for this sword...
We keep the first sword simple.
I've added a few things to the crucible. Is that enough?
No, we need more...
28 metal bars worth. Weapon and armour can go into crucible too but some metal lost when melted down.
Right, that's the crucible full. Can I make the sword yet?
Kovac think we need to set up a mould.
What's a mould used for?
Kovac think mould will determine the type of sword to be made.
Remember, we need a Flat Broad sword.
Okay, so how do I go about setting up a mould?
Kovac remember being told a sword is made from three parts...
a forte, a blade and a tip.
Use mould jig behind you...
You can select part for each selecti... section.
Each mould part is differing...
They will suit different commissions better...
Look for parts that match commission.
Right... I think I'm with you.
If you are still confused...
come back to me.
I'm sorry Kovac, but I'm not entirely sure what I'm meant to be doing.
That is okay...
Kovac not so sure of himself...
but you help Kovac, so Kovac help you.
Thanks Kovac. You're gentle for a giant.
So what was it I needed to do at the mould jig?
We need to fill each part of the mould...
Forte, blade and tip.
We want to use mould parts that match collisi... commission Kovac give you.
Remember, each part suit a differing sword better...
Look for ones that match Flat and Broad.
Right, the mould is setup and the crucible is full to the brim. We must be ready to pour.
let me look.
Yes, all things look correct...
Well done little one. We are ready.
Pour the metal from the crucible into the mould...
then take out the preform.
Once you have done that...
Kovac will tell how to work the preform.
The metal's too hot to pick up!
What do I do?
Cool it down...
What do you expect?
Ah, of course... How do I do that?
Kovac do not know. Try pouring water on it.
I'm not sure what to do next...
take the preform and put it in your hand. Then come see Kovac for help.
Okay Kovac, I've got this huge burning hot sword. What do I do with it?
Now for fun part.
Use tools around the foundry to reclin... refine the preform.
How do I know which tool I need to use?
Kovac not too sure. Kovac's gut feeling says use trip hammer first.
This is very impoten... important...
The preform needs to be within a certain heat range to work properly.
If you use the wrong tool...
or tool at wrong heat, we damage the preform quality.
A sword with low quality is bad...
Means less giants will want it, so Kovac give less for it.
If you damage a preform too much, it will become junk and Kovac will have to throw it away...
but this first attent... attempt, so do not worry about quality too much.
You use trip hammer first. Trip hammer need preform to be quite hot.
If the preform at wrong temperature...
You can hot it up by dunking it in lava or cold it by holding it to waterfall.
Alright, I'll give it a go.
Remember, try trip hammer first with hot preform.
I'm not sure which tool I need to use next.
Hmm... you need to use the trip hammer.
Make sure preform is nice and hot...
Trip hammer needs a high temperature.
Stop!
What did I do wrong?
You're damaging the preform!
How?
The sword is too cold. We need to heat it up to use it on the trip hammer.
Oh, my bad!
Using wrong tool. We should be using the grindstone.
Using wrong tool. We should be using the trip hammer.
time to move over to the grindstone.
The preform need to be warm...
Fictio... friction from grindstone will heat the preform up as well.
The sword is too hot. We need to cool it down to use it on the grindstone.
The sword is too cold. We need to heat it up to use it on the grindstone.
Using wrong tool. We should be using the polishing wheel.
You are almost done...
You just need to use polishing wheel to finish preform off.
Preform need to be quite cool to work with polishing wheel.
The sword is too hot. We need to cool it down to use it on the polishing wheel.
The sword is too cold. We need to heat it up to use it on the polishing wheel.
Looks like the sword is finished. I should take it to Kovac.
I should finish helping Kovac before I try making another sword.
Okay Kovac, I think I've finally finished the sword!
Hmm... let Kovac look.
This is defeanin... definitely a sword...
Well done little one.
Sorry it's not very good. I'm still getting use to everything.
That is okay. You do better than Kovac could...
We still leanin... learning.
So what do we do with it now?
Kovac take care of it.
Out of curiosity, who is this first blade for?
Kovac friend...
Obor.
Obor? Can't say I've heard of them.
Obor? He's just going to use it to kill me!
Obor good friend. Kovac know he only attack if you trespass his cave...
Maybe you should have some manners and knock first.
Well, you're not wrong there... I normally just let myself in.
Yes, manner very important.
Kovac think Obor show other giants how strong our swords are. Then every giant want one.
That's a pretty clever marketing plan, I must admit.
Kovac know what he do sometime... Thank you for help. You free to use foundry whenever you want.

characters.name: Hill Giant
characters.description: Adult male, deep gravelly voice, slow halting speech with Eastern European accent, gentle and desperate tone. A rare speaking giant who struggles to form words but is earnest and non-threatening.

characters.name: Kovac
characters.description: Adult male, deep rumbling voice, slow deliberate speech with Slavic accent, patient and thoughtful tone. A gentle hill giant blacksmith who stumbles over words but shows intelligence and kindness.
